intro: Hieracium radyrense, commonly known as the Radish Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. Hieracium radyrense is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
